intro: Tithymalus panaceus, commonly known as the panacea tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. Tithymalus panaceus is noted for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
